comments.body: The updated tol is needed to allow it to pass - and matches the tol in the R code that was used to generate 'correct' answers, so seems OK. Same with maxIter. I made a similar change throughout this test suite for consistency.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +535,539 @@      for (solver <- WeightedLeastSquares.supportedSolvers) {
        val wls = new WeightedLeastSquares(fitIntercept, regParam, elasticNetParam = 0.0,
          standardizeFeatures = standardization, standardizeLabel = true, solverType = solver,
          tol = 1e-14, maxIter = 100000)
          .fit(instances)
